marketNews.title: US Consumer Price Index Slows for Fifth Consecutive Month to 2.5% YoY in August 2024
marketNews.content: The US consumer price index (CPI) slowed for the fifth consecutive month to a year‑on‑year level of 2.5% in August 2024 (July 2024: 2.9% YoY), below the consensus expectation of 2.6% YoY and marking the lowest level since February 2021. On a month‑on‑month basis, inflation was 0.2% in August, matching the consensus. Core inflation remained at a three‑year low of 3.2% YoY, but rose slightly to 0.3% MoM, above the consensus of 0.2% MoM.

marketNews.title: China Customs Reports Crude Oil Imports Rise 15.9% MoM to 11.56 Million Barrels per Day in August 2024
marketNews.content: China’s customs reported that the country imported 11.56 million barrels per day of crude oil in August 2024, a 15.9% month‑on‑month increase. Reuters reported that the rise was likely caused by lower global oil prices. Despite the monthly increase, China’s crude oil imports in August 2024 were down 7% year‑on‑year, and the 8‑month‑to‑date (8M24) volume fell 3.1% YoY.

marketNews.title: Deputy Finance Minister Denies Rumors of Sri Mulyani Being Offered Finance Minister Position
marketNews.content: Deputy Finance Minister Thomas Djiwandono refuted rumors that President‑elect Prabowo Subianto offered the finance minister position to Sri Mulyani. Katadata reported that the rumor arose after Sri Mulyani, Thomas, and Prabowo met on Monday, 9 September.

marketNews.title: Indonesia OOH Advertising Industry Hit Hard by New Tobacco Advertising Ban
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Out‑of‑Home Advertising Association, Fabianus Bernadi, said that Government Regulation No. 28 of 2024 on Health, which bans tobacco product advertisements within 500 meters of schools and children’s play areas, has caused 7% of OOH advertising companies in Indonesia to go bankrupt. He noted that tobacco ads contributed 50% of revenue for 30% of OOH advertising firms. The association estimates the regulation could lead to job losses for about 60% of workers in the OOH advertising industry.

marketNews.title: OJK Tightens IPO Funds Utilization Reporting Regulations
marketNews.content: The Head of the Capital Market, Derivatives, and Carbon Exchange Supervision at OJK, Inarno Djajadi, said the regulator is refining OJK Regulation 30/POJK.04/2015 on Reporting the Realization of IPO Proceeds to tighten the use of IPO funds. The amendment will require more detailed disclosure of IPO fund utilization, including at subsidiary level, and will align the details in the prospectus with actual use. The tightening follows observations that some issuers have not fully used IPO proceeds.

tickerNews.title: ADRO Plans Spin-off of Thermal Coal Business
tickerNews.content:
Adaro Energy Indonesia (ADRO) plans to spin off and sell its entire thermal coal business under PT Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AAI). The sale of AAI shares will be carried out through an initial public offering (PUPS) to existing shareholders who are interested. ADRO is also considering a cash dividend to all shareholders, which could be used to help finance shareholders who wish to participate in the AAI PUPS.

The offering price for the AAI PUPS will use the volume weighted average price (VWAP) formed after market close on the record date, while ensuring transaction fairness as regulated in POJK No. 35 of 2020. According to an assessment by a public appraisal firm, the fair price of AAI is estimated at 2.45‑2.6 billion US dollars.

The plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on 18 October 2024.

AAI is a subsidiary of ADRO with 99.99% ownership and operates in thermal coal and supporting services for coal mining. Its business lines include logistics services, land services, water, investments, and power generation.

As of 1H24, AAI has total assets of 5.4 billion US dollars, representing 52.9% of ADRO’s total assets. In the same period, AAI’s revenue and net profit were 2.6 billion US dollars and 992.8 million US dollars, respectively, representing 89.4% of ADRO’s revenue and 104.8% of ADRO’s net profit. The net profit includes a non‑recurring income of 322.9 million US dollars that is excluded from ADRO’s net profit.

Key Takeaway: After this transaction, ADRO will focus on the metallurgical coal segment under Adaro Minerals (ADMR) and the renewable energy segment under Adaro Green. The proceeds from the AAI spin‑off can be used by the company to fund organic or inorganic expansion or to distribute dividends to shareholders.

Based on the fair price of AAI and its 1H24 financials, excluding the non‑recurring profit of 322.9 million US dollars, AAI could be valued at 1.8‑2 times FY24F annualized P/E. This valuation is far below its peers, ITMG and PTBA, which trade at FY24F annualized P/E of 7.04 and 7.71 respectively.

The transaction could also benefit Saratoga Investama Sedaya (SRTG), which holds about 15% of ADRO, as SRTG may receive a special dividend from the spin‑off and will have the option to participate in the AAI share offering.

tickerNews.title: ANZ Group Rumored to Divest 38.8% Stake in PNBN
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reports that ANZ Group Holdings Ltd., the shareholder of Bank Pan Indonesia, is reconsidering selling its entire 38.8% stake in PNBN to reduce its exposure to several long‑held Asian assets. Bloomberg cited that ANZ has engaged financial advisers to divest the stake, with potential buyers including Japanese and Malaysian banks. Previously, ANZ attempted to sell PNBN in 2015, but negotiations stalled because PNBN’s controlling shareholders refused to grant a board seat to the new investor. Bloomberg also noted that Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc. and Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group Inc. had previously considered buying PNBN but withdrew over valuation issues.

tickerNews.title: Astra International Reports Decline in Domestic Car Wholesales in August 2024
tickerNews.content: Astra International recorded domestic car wholesales of 42,195 units in August 2024, down 3.6% month‑on‑month (MoM) and 17% year‑on‑year (YoY). This result was lower than the growth in non‑ASII car sales, which rose 12% MoM and fell 10.5% YoY. Consequently, ASII’s market share fell to 55.3% in August 2024 (July 2024: 59%; August 2023: 57.1%). The decline was driven by lower sales of Daihatsu (13,829 units, –0.6% MoM, –20.9% YoY) and Toyota and Lexus (26,183 units, –4.1% MoM, –13.8% YoY). Over the first eight months of 2024, ASII’s wholesales dropped 15.8% YoY with a market share of 56.7% (8M23: 55.8%).

tickerNews.title: Medco Energi International Announces Interim Dividend of 15.75 Rupiah per Share for FY2024
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Medco Energi Internasional, Hilmi Panigoro, said the company will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 of 15.75 rupiah per share. He did not specify the distribution date.

tickerNews.title: Sonny Satia Negara Sells 368,000 SSIA Shares at Average Price 1,358.2 Rupiah per Share
tickerNews.content: Sonny Satia Negara, Director of Surya Semesta Internusa, sold 368,000 SSIA shares at an average price of 1,358.2 rupiah per share between 6 and 9 September 2024. The total transaction value was approximately 500 million rupiah. After the transaction, his ownership in SSIA decreased from 0.078% to 0.070%.

tickerNews.title: Bambang Prijonohadi Sells 60,000 KKGI Shares at Average Price 596.63 Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Bambang Prijonohadi, Director of Resource Alam Indonesia, sold 60,000 KKGI shares at an average price of 596.63 rupiah per share on 10 September 2024. The total transaction value was 35.8 million rupiah. After the transaction, his ownership in KKGI fell from 0.002% to 0.001%.

tickerNews.title: PT Anugerah Inti Karisma Sells 3.2 Million PEGE Shares
tickerNews.content: PT Anugerah Inti Karisma, a shareholder of Panca Global Kapital, sold 3.2 million PEGE shares, according to KSEI data as of 10 September 2024. The transaction value was not disclosed. After the sale, its ownership in PEGE decreased from 16.45% to 16.34%.

tickerNews.title: Hexa Prima Nusantara to Acquire Controlling Stake in FUTR
tickerNews.content: Lini Imaji Kreasi Ekosistem announced that PT Hexa Prima Nusantara plans to acquire a majority stake in FUTR’s controlling shareholder, PT Digital Futurama Global. After the transaction, PT Hexa Prima Nusantara will become the new controlling shareholder of FUTR and will carry out a mandatory tender offer.

tickerNews.title: Johan Tedja Surya Purchases Approximately 5.6 Million AMAN Shares at Average Price 112 Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Johan Tedja Surya, controlling shareholder and President Commissioner of Makmur Berkah Amanda (AMAN), purchased approximately 5.6 million AMAN shares at an average price of 112 rupiah per share on 10 September 2024. The total transaction value was about 624 million rupiah. After the transaction, his ownership increased from 0.92% to 1.06%.
